frontmatter.title: How to Calculate Median
frontmatter.summary: Master the calculation of median - the middle value in your dataset. Learn to handle both odd and even number of values, and understand when median is better than mean.

seo.metaDescription: Step-by-step guide to calculating median with examples. Learn to find the middle value for both odd and even datasets.

outcomes: Find median for odd number of values
Find median for even number of values

steps.name: Collect Your Data
steps.description: Gather all your data points. Example: 7, 3, 15, 9, 21, 12, 18
steps.tip: Make sure you have all values - missing data will affect the median

steps.name: Sort the Data
steps.description: Arrange values from smallest to largest: 3, 7, 9, 12, 15, 18, 21
steps.warning: This step is crucial! The median won't be correct if data isn't sorted

steps.name: Count the Values
steps.description: Count how many data points you have. In our example: 7 values
steps.tip: This determines whether you have an odd or even number of values

steps.name: Find the Middle Position
steps.description: For odd count: Position = (n+1)/2 = (7+1)/2 = 4th position. For even count: Positions = n/2 and (n/2)+1
steps.tip: For odd numbers, there's one middle value. For even numbers, there are two middle values

steps.name: Identify the Median (Odd Count)
steps.description: For our 7 values, the 4th position value is 12. So median = 12
steps.tip: Just pick the value at the middle position

steps.name: Calculate Median (Even Count)
steps.description: If you had 6 values (3, 7, 9, 12, 15, 18), take positions 3 and 4: (9 + 12) รท 2 = 10.5
steps.tip: Always average the two middle values for even counts

steps.name: Verify Your Answer
steps.description: Check that half the values are below and half are above your median (allowing for the median itself)
steps.warning: If this isn't true, recheck your sorting and calculations

steps.name: Compare with Mean
steps.description: Calculate the mean too: (3+7+9+12+15+18+21)/7 = 12.14. Notice how close they are when no outliers exist
steps.tip: Large differences between mean and median suggest skewed data or outliers

content: The median is the middle value when data is ordered from smallest to largest. Unlike the mean, it's not affected by extreme outliers, making it ideal for skewed distributions like income or house prices. This guide covers everything you need to find the median correctly every time.
